Row.Text: Humble Advice
A cult of personality reveres Cromwell's leadership. A petition from the public suggests he name himself King.
They are right. Providence has handed me the power of a King.
{1_reward}.
No. Providence has shown that the days of Kings are over.
{1_reward}.
Lieutenant-General of the Horse
Cromwell's origins as a cavalry commander have inspired the people to revere the horse as a holy creature, too noble to be put to work.
Touching, but absurd. Put the beasts back to work.
{1_reward} on Horses.
Perhaps the horse is indeed a symbol of divine providence.
{1_reward} on Horses.
The Matter of Prayer
There are those who claim that the gods are beyond our comprehension. But if Cromwell, a mere man, can be a vehicle for divine providence, surely anyone can form a connection with the beyond.
The gods speak to us all, individually.
{1_reward}.
Only the priests, chosen by the gods, may interpret divine auspices.
{1_reward}.
Let each polity decide for itself.
{1_reward}.
The Bury Conference
Soldiers are reluctant to fight in far fields beyond their homes. The grandees of the army have assembled to solve this problem.
Reorganise them into larger, more diverse regiments.
{1_reward}.
Problem? It is right that they defend what they hold dear.
{1_reward} on Military Buildings.
The Ironsides
Still loyal to him from his days as an officer, Cromwell's old troop of Ironsides offer their service.
The Ironsides
Appoint these loyal servicemen to high-ranking political offices.
{1_reward}.
Political rivals have written treatises, complaining of nepotism and espousing meritocratic government.
Build an Amphitheatre
The Ironsides
They will train the next generation of soldiers.
{1_reward}.
A New Model Army has been created in the Ironsides' image.
Build a Barracks
Welcome them to the ranks of your armies.
{1_reward}.
A Petition
The meritocratic treatise has gained traction. A public assembly has gathered at the Palace.
A Petition
In time, they will learn that service is the highest form of merit.
{1_reward}.
Dissenters continue to express their doubts, but Cromwell's rule appears resolute in the face of challengers.
Have at least two Army Commanders
This treatise does have merit. Appoint its authors to new roles in government.
{1_reward}.
Factionalism
One of Cromwell's regiments has adopted a radical set of political beliefs, and murmur that he should step down as ruler.
Factionalism
The ringleader must be... Dealt with.
{1_reward}.
The soldiers mourn the passing of their leader. Without a steady hand to guide them, their political ambitions falter and fade.
An Army Commander must die.
Perhaps we should hold elections.
{1_reward}.
Debates in the Ranks
Military encampments have become centres of political activity. Soldiers debate politics by the fire, and regiments adopt ideological identities.
Politics is a stepping stone towards desertion and mutiny.
{1_reward}.
Raise a budding politician from the ranks. It'll inspire the troops.
{1_reward}.
Let them imagine the country they wish to fight for.
{1_reward} on Military and Production Buildings.
Solemn League and Covenant
We have an opportunity to bring our neighbours to our side. Much of the soldiery, however, fears foreign influence in our affairs.
Foreign nations can be of great service to our cause.
Increase Relationship with a nearby Independent Power.
It is unwise to upset the people we ask to die for our cause.
{1_reward}.
An Ordinance for Abolishing of Festivals
Parliament has passed a law banning celebrations. They say the people have grown lazy. The people, meanwhile, mock the grey suits, grey voices, and grey attitudes of this puritan government.
Parliament is right. End the festivities!
{1_reward}.
The people are right. Dissolve this parliament!
{1_reward}.
Pamphlet Wars
The booming of industry has led to factories being weapons of political warfare. They mass produce ideological pamphlets and radicalise the people.
Let them spread their ideas.
{1_reward} but {2_reward} on Production Buildings.
Pass laws against such pamphlets that criticise the state.
{1_reward} but {2_reward} on Production Buildings.
The Self-Denying Ordinance
A prominent politician has come forth with a proposal. They seek to bar anyone holding an active military role from Parliament.
Who is more dedicated to the nation than our officers? They will stay.
Story continues.
They are right. Officers should focus on military duties.
Story continues.
Agitators in the Army
The military has become a hotbed of radicalism at all levels. The soldiers' elected representatives have presented an egalitarian manifesto.
Agitators in the Army
Require every soldier to sign a declaration of loyalty.
{1_reward} and adopt the Revolutionary Authoritarianism Government.
The soldiers clamoured to refuse to sign the declaration. In the confusion, they failed to pass their manifesto into law.
Adopt the Levies Social Policy.
The agitators have a point. Adopt their manifesto.
{1_reward} and adopt the Revolutionary Republic Government.
The Fifth Monarchists
Providence has shown the divine right of Kings to be no more. Many now believe this is a sign that the end times are upon us, and the Kingdom of Heaven is nigh.
The Fifth Monarchists
They are right, and I am its herald.
{1_reward} in all Settlements.
But let's hope the end times aren't too soon...
Have 6 Points in the Toshakhana Legacy Path.
The Diggers and Levellers
Rural folk have started claiming the farms for themselves: forming small communes where all share in the fruits of the land equally.
The Diggers and Levellers
Inform the gentry. It's their land, and we will help reclaim it.
{1_reward} and adopt the Revolutionary Authoritarianism Government.
Gangs of brutes called 'clubmen' now roam the countryside, defending the property rights of the aristocracy.
Build two Dungeons.
Now there's a grand idea.
{1_reward} and adopt the Revolutionary Republic Government.
Pride's Purge
Cromwell's generals approach with a petition. They are concerned that, in their absence, the beliefs of the radical 'Diggers' and 'Levellers' are becoming popular in Parliament.
Pride's Purge
Expel the radicals. We will promise a land of opportunity, far from here.
{1_reward} in Settlements in Distant Lands.
Dissatisfied radicals seek new lives across the sea. The more radical segments of the army are assigned to fight abroad, at arms reach from the homelands.
Have 6 Points in the Non Sufficit Orbis Legacy Path.
The Secret Treaty
A {1_OWNER_EXPLORATION_CIVILIZATION_ADJ} pretender to the abolished Kingship has made a secret deal with the {2_OPPONENT_CIVILIZATION_ADJ} to have themselves installed as King once more.
The {1_OWNER_EXPLORATION_CIVILIZATION_ADJ} Yoke shall never return. To war!
{1_reward} but start a War.
Organise a mob. The pretender will be caught and hanged.
{1_reward} but {2_reward} on Happiness Buildings.
A White Dogge Called Boye
A popular new opera tells the story of a prominent general who fought against Cromwell in the Civil War. Much of it centres on a poodle who seems to have magic powers.
Ban it. We will not aggrandise our enemies.
{1_reward}.
That dog was a devil and the world should know!
{1_reward}.
Come Out, You Cuckold
A band of revolutionaries hoping to restore the monarchy have taken to the streets. They have adopted a flag insulting Cromwell's honour.
Have the symbols burnt, along with those who held them.
{1_reward} on Food Buildings.
All will see this for the juvenile antic that it is.
{1_reward} on Military Buildings.
Lunacy Rampant
A play has been written that claims Cromwell was raised by a conjurer. An actor mimicks him with a whining voice and ridiculous postures.
Ban it!
{1_reward} but {2_reward}.
Hire this playwrite for more noble works.
{1_reward} but {2_reward}.
With Spades and Hoes and Ploughs
The police maintain a far smaller presence in the countrysides. Without the law to hold them to account, many have been evading taxes and claiming their villages are 'sovereign'.
Expand the police force into the countryside.
{1_reward}.
They won't last long.
{1_reward}.
The Siege of Oxford
A revolution broke out in the intellectual heartland of our nation. Thankfully, after three long sieges, Oxford has been recaptured. What role will it now play?
It will be renewed as a centre of science.
{1_reward}.
Its skills are needed in Government.
{1_reward}.
Treasures from the Days of the King

There is a growing fascination with the relics of the old {1_OWNER_EXPLORATION_CIVILIZATION_ADJ} Kings. Many lament that we no longer produce works of such grandeur, and whisper of the death of our nation's culture.
Exhibit them, but alongside warnings against such decadence.
{1_reward}.
These wonders were wrought through tyranny. Destroy them.
{1_reward}.
The Good Old Cause
The question of Cromwell's succession is being raised. Divine Providence placed him on a throne of his own making. But who in the nation he has built could be worthy of this office when he is gone?
The Good Old Cause
The inheritor of my talents will be the inheritor of my office. I choose my son.
{1_reward}
Cromwell's rule has been cemented with an iron fist. His dynasty will reign for generations, with none to stand in its way.
Research the Absolutism Civic on the Fascism path.
The people shall decide.
+1 [icon:YIELD_CULTURE]Culture on Specialists, but -1 [icon:YIELD_PRODUCTION]Production in Towns.
The people themselves shall rule!
+2 [icon:YIELD_FOOD]Food on Specialists, but -1 [icon:YIELD_HAPPINESS]Happiness in Towns.
The Green Ribbon Club
At pubs and working men's clubs across the country, the people trade tales of the idealism of their forefathers, lost since the days of the Civil War.
The Green Ribbon Club
Whatever they dream of, what they need is strong government.
{1_reward}
Through youth clubs, a pervasive police force, and rigid hierarchy at all levels of society, the people have come to respect order.
Research the Absolutism Civic on the Fascism path.
Perhaps the nation should be a forum of ideas once more. Call an election!
+1 [icon:YIELD_CULTURE]Culture on Specialists, but -1 [icon:YIELD_PRODUCTION]Production in Towns.
I will give them the world they dream of.
+2 [icon:YIELD_FOOD]Food on Specialists, but -1 [icon:YIELD_HAPPINESS]Happiness in Towns.
